result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All parties must appear in person due to this hearing being in the small courtroom.

Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse E. Shields. Attorney Ocwieja states that an offer was given but not accepted by JS. Attorney Ocwieja speaks about cash bond modification and indicates that if bond isn't modified then a motion for a speedy jury trial will be filled. Attorney Ocwieja states that the victims are here today. Attorney Forehand speaks and objects to a bond modification. Victim speaks. 

Attorney Ocwieja asks for a condition to be add that the defendant "Take medication that is prescribed by his doctor." Court speaks. 

Parties speak about the 21CF56. Attorney Forehand suggest handling the revocation first.

JS would like a trial date.

Court will set a motion hearing re: revoking DPA for 21CF56 on 08/18 at 11:30.

Attorney Forehand possible will file a motion to join 22CF02/22CF03. Attorney Forehand asks for 3 days for the jury trial. 

Court speaks about bail. 
Court a signature bond on 22CF02

03:50 PM Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video means for Defendant Jesse E. Shields. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jesse E. Shields appeared by video means in the Richland County jail. Attorney Ocwieja comments about the second opinion and notes that his client had received the report but doesn't agree with it. JS states that he feels that he is competent. Attorney Forehand asks if JS is willing to stipulate or agree with being committed. JS agrees. Attorney Ocwieja explains to JS that if he agrees then he will be committed. JS asks when that would be. Court states it would start today. Court is hearing that JS doesn't agree but is in agreement to find him incompetent. Court orders that JS to take his abilify medication.

records.addlTxt: Def will not be required to repay Richland County in this matter.
For next hearing on 1/3/22 at 1 p.m. sent to dispatch, Atty. Forehand, DA secretary, and Atty. Ocweija in the form of an email notice from the clerk. Zoom info provided.

1:20 p.m. by Zoom. Today was set as the date for the initial appearance in this matter. Complaint has not yet been filed. Def appeared by video from the Richland County Jail without counsel. ADA Amy Forehand appeared by video for the State. Court asks Def if he's called SPD. Def states he has not and am unable to afford an attorney; would like to have the same attorney who represented him for felony diversion agreement (Atty. Ocweija). Court will appoint Atty. O. Def states he cannot afford that; will try to contact SPD. Atty. Forehand states she's been unable to file a complaint because she has not received the reports; notes Def is on a probation hold. Court asks Def how long the probation hold will be. Court appoints Atty. O for free to the Def. Def will not be required to reimburse Richland County. Def has a $10,000 cash bond in this matter that he has refused to sign. Court notes concerns about Def not taking medications. Further review set for 1/3/22 at 1 p.m. Court notes that, if Atty. O wants a hearing prior to 1/3, he can file a motion with the Court.
No contact with the victim, victim's wife or the residence.
